Articles.Content:
So. I'm struggling with this one - I'm guessing I should just try shallower re-entry angles and multiple aerobraking orbits, but, in case there's another option...

My wings keep burning off my space planes on re-entry. Am I missing something? Any tips on avoiding having planes melt?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T21:06:52Z" title="04/28/2015 09:06  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by JimTheDog**
Try aiming higher than average (35 km), and making S-curves by turning in the atmosphere before the "reentry" really starts heating up. Also, airbrakes. Up high, those are really useful.

Hmmmmm.

I will give these things a shot, and hopefully stop killing tourists. I don't have airbrakes unlocked yet, but I suppose I can do something similar manually with sets of flaps...
Also try deploying your parachutes early on, they are invulnerable to heating effects. (The 'chute bit, not the attached part)

> 
> Also try deploying your parachutes early on, they are invulnerable to heating effects. (The 'chute bit, not the attached part)

SERIOUSLY, LOL!

I cant believe squad didnt at leats make chutes burn off when deployed? Makes 0 logical sense ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif). What are they made out of, no flexible material would be realistically resistant to a 8km/s reentry.
